alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Knox; Somerset; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 6:30PM EST until January 14 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Kennebec County in south central Maine... Northwestern Knox County in south central Maine... Western Waldo County in south central Maine... Southeastern Somerset County in west central Maine... * Until 730 PM EST. * At 630 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Bingham to 6 miles east of Gardiner, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 114 and 156. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Waterville, Rockland, Fairfield, Gardiner, Camden, Lincolnville, Oakland, Skowhegan, Pittsfield, Thorndike, Madison, China, Clinton, Belgrade, Farmingdale, Bingham, Liberty, Palermo, and Unity. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
